intro: Pimpinella forrestii, commonly known as the Chinese茴香, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and flowers. It is native to China and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring compound leaves with serrated edges. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits.
